intro: Elliottia pyroliflora, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Elliottia pyroliflora is often found in woodland habitats and is considered a rare and endangered species.
